title: First still of Black Hole
brief_description: The Event Horizon Telescope—a planet-scale array of ground-based radio telescopes—has obtained the first image of a supermassive black hole and its shadow. The image, taken in 2019, reveals the central black hole of Messier 87, a massive galaxy in the Virgo cluster.

constellations_other.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes
constellations_other.description: Magic lantern slides were used to entertain and educate audiences in home, theatres and universities. While performers told jokes and fairytales, travelling showmen unveiled exotic locations and scientists revealed the latest discoveries.

constellations_other.name: Space, cinema and fakes
constellations_other.description: Before and after humans stepped foot on the moon, outer-space and the stars have inspired filmmakers, artists and game makers to imagine what's beyond our atmosphere.

description: The Event Horizon Telescope—a planet-scale array of ground-based radio telescopes—has obtained the first image of a supermassive black hole and its shadow. The image, taken in 2019, reveals the central black hole of Messier 87, a massive galaxy in the Virgo cluster. – National Geographic
